fr.sii.ogham.template.freemarker.builder

Class FreemarkerConfigurationBuilder<P>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.fluent.AbstractParent<P>
      • fr.sii.ogham.template.freemarker.builder.FreemarkerConfigurationBuilder<P>
  • Type Parameters:
    P - the type of the parent builder (when calling AbstractParent.and() method)
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<freemarker.template.Configuration>, Parent<P>

    public class FreemarkerConfigurationBuilder<P>
extends AbstractParent<P>
implements Builder<freemarker.template.Configuration>
    Fluent builder to configure Freemarker configuration object.

      • FreemarkerConfigurationBuilder

        public FreemarkerConfigurationBuilder(P parent,
                                      BuildContext buildContext)
        Initializes the builder with a parent builder. The parent builder is used when calling AbstractParent.and() method. The EnvironmentBuilder is used to evaluate properties when build() method is called.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent builder
        buildContext - for registering instances and property evaluation

      • defaultEncoding

        public FreemarkerConfigurationBuilder<P> defaultEncoding(String charsetName)
        * Sets the charset used for decoding byte sequences to character sequences when reading template files in a locale for which no explicit encoding was specified via Configuration.setEncoding(Locale, String). Note that by default there is no locale specified for any locale, so the default encoding is always in effect.

        Defaults to the default system encoding, which can change from one server to another, so you should always set this setting. If you don't know what charset your should chose, "UTF-8" is usually a good choice.

        Note that individual templates may specify their own charset by starting with <#ftl encoding="...">

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using defaultEncoding(). 

         .defaultEncoding("UTF-16")
 .defaultEncoding()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("UTF-8")
 
         .defaultEncoding("UTF-16")
 .defaultEncoding()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("UTF-8")
        In both cases, defaultEncoding("UTF-16") is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        charsetName - the name of the charset
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • defaultEncoding

        public ConfigurationValueBuilder<FreemarkerConfigurationBuilder<P>,String> defaultEncoding()
        * Sets the charset used for decoding byte sequences to character sequences when reading template files in a locale for which no explicit encoding was specified via Configuration.setEncoding(Locale, String). Note that by default there is no locale specified for any locale, so the default encoding is always in effect.

        Defaults to the default system encoding, which can change from one server to another, so you should always set this setting. If you don't know what charset your should chose, "UTF-8" is usually a good choice.

        Note that individual templates may specify their own charset by starting with <#ftl encoding="...">

        This method is mainly used by Configurers to register some property keys and/or a default value. The aim is to let developer be able to externalize its configuration (using system properties, configuration file or anything else). If the developer doesn't configure any value for the registered properties, the default value is used (if set). 

         .defaultEncoding()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("UTF-8")

        Non-null value set using defaultEncoding(String) takes precedence over property values and default value. 

         .defaultEncoding("UTF-16")
 .defaultEncoding()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("UTF-8")
        The value "UTF-16" is used regardless of the value of the properties and default value.

        See ConfigurationValueBuilder for more information.

        Returns:
        the builder to configure property keys/default value

      • templateExceptionHandler

        public FreemarkerConfigurationBuilder<P> templateExceptionHandler(freemarker.template.TemplateExceptionHandler exceptionHandler)
        Sets the exception handler used to handle exceptions occurring inside templates. The default is TemplateExceptionHandler.DEBUG_HANDLER. The recommended values are:
        • In production systems: TemplateExceptionHandler.RETHROW_HANDLER
        • During development of HTML templates: TemplateExceptionHandler.HTML_DEBUG_HANDLER
        • During development of non-HTML templates: TemplateExceptionHandler.DEBUG_HANDLER

        All of these will let the exception propagate further, so that you can catch it around Template.process(Object, Writer) for example. The difference is in what they print on the output before they do that.

        Note that the TemplateExceptionHandler is not meant to be used for generating HTTP error pages. Neither is it meant to be used to roll back the printed output. These should be solved outside template processing when the exception raises from Template.process. TemplateExceptionHandler meant to be used if you want to include special content in the template output, or if you want to suppress certain exceptions.

        Parameters:
        exceptionHandler - the exception handler
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • addSharedVariable

        public FreemarkerConfigurationBuilder<P> addSharedVariable(String name,
                                                           freemarker.template.TemplateModel tm)
        Adds a shared variable to the configuration. Shared sharedVariables are sharedVariables that are visible as top-level sharedVariables for all templates which use this configuration, if the data model does not contain a variable with the same name.

        Never use TemplateModel implementation that is not thread-safe for shared sharedVariables, if the configuration is used by multiple threads! It is the typical situation for Servlet based Web sites.

        This method is not thread safe; use it with the same restrictions as those that modify setting values.

        Parameters:
        name - the name used to access the data object from your template. If a shared variable with this name already exists, it will replace that.
        tm - the data object value directly available as a TemplateModel
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining
        See Also:
        addSharedVariables(freemarker.template.TemplateHashModelEx), addSharedVariable(String,Object)

      • addSharedVariable

        public FreemarkerConfigurationBuilder<P> addSharedVariable(String name,
                                                           Object value)
        Adds shared variable to the configuration; It uses Configurable.getObjectWrapper() to wrap the value, so it's important that the object wrapper is set before this.

        This method is not thread safe; use it with the same restrictions as those that modify setting values.

        The added value should be thread safe, if you are running templates from multiple threads with this configuration.

        Parameters:
        name - the name used to access the data object from your template. If a shared variable with this name already exists, it will replace that.
        value - the data object value
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining
        See Also:
        addSharedVariable(String,TemplateModel), addSharedVariables(TemplateHashModelEx)

      • enableStaticMethodAccess

        public FreemarkerConfigurationBuilder<P> enableStaticMethodAccess(Boolean enable)
        Enable calls to static methods from templates: 
         ${statics['foo.bar.StringUtils'].capitalize(name)}

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using enableStaticMethodAccess(). 

         .enableStaticMethodAccess(true)
 .enableStaticMethodAccess()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(false)
 
         .enableStaticMethodAccess(true)
 .enableStaticMethodAccess()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(false)
        In both cases, enableStaticMethodAccess(true) is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        enable - enable or disable static method access
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • enableStaticMethodAccess

        public ConfigurationValueBuilder<FreemarkerConfigurationBuilder<P>,Boolean> enableStaticMethodAccess()
        Enable calls to static methods from templates: 
         ${statics['foo.bar.StringUtils'].capitalize(name)}

        This method is mainly used by Configurers to register some property keys and/or a default value. The aim is to let developer be able to externalize its configuration (using system properties, configuration file or anything else). If the developer doesn't configure any value for the registered properties, the default value is used (if set). 

         .enableStaticMethodAccess()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(false)

        Non-null value set using enableStaticMethodAccess(Boolean) takes precedence over property values and default value. 

         .enableStaticMethodAccess(true)
 .enableStaticMethodAccess()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(false)
        The value true is used regardless of the value of the properties and default value.

        See ConfigurationValueBuilder for more information.

        Returns:
        the builder to configure property keys/default value

      • staticMethodAccessVariableName

        public FreemarkerConfigurationBuilder<P> staticMethodAccessVariableName(String variableName)
        Change the name of the variable used to access static methods.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using staticMethodAccessVariableName(). 

         .staticMethodAccessVariableName("myStatics")
 .staticMethodAccessVariableName()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("statics")
 
         .staticMethodAccessVariableName("myStatics")
 .staticMethodAccessVariableName()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("statics")
        In both cases, staticMethodAccessVariableName("myStatics") is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        variableName - the name of the variable used to access static methods from templates
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • staticMethodAccessVariableName

        public ConfigurationValueBuilder<FreemarkerConfigurationBuilder<P>,String> staticMethodAccessVariableName()
        Change the name of the variable used to access static methods.

        This method is mainly used by Configurers to register some property keys and/or a default value. The aim is to let developer be able to externalize its configuration (using system properties, configuration file or anything else). If the developer doesn't configure any value for the registered properties, the default value is used (if set). 

         .staticMethodAccessVariableName()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("statics")

        Non-null value set using staticMethodAccessVariableName(String) takes precedence over property values and default value. 

         .staticMethodAccessVariableName("myStatics")
 .staticMethodAccessVariableName()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("statics")
        The value "myStatics" is used regardless of the value of the properties and default value.

        See ConfigurationValueBuilder for more information.

        Returns:

      • addSharedVariables

        public FreemarkerConfigurationBuilder<P> addSharedVariables(freemarker.template.TemplateHashModelEx variables)
        Adds all object in the hash as shared variable to the configuration; it's like doing several addSharedVariable(String, Object) calls, one for each hash entry. It doesn't remove the already added shared variable before doing this.

        Never use TemplateModel implementation that is not thread-safe for shared shared variable values, if the configuration is used by multiple threads! It is the typical situation for Servlet based Web sites.

        This method is not thread safe; use it with the same restrictions as those that modify setting values.

        Parameters:
        variables - a hash model whose objects will be copied to the configuration with same names as they are given in the hash. If a shared variable with these names already exist, it will be replaced with those from the map.
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • build

        public freemarker.template.Configuration build()
        Description copied from interface: Builder
        Instantiate and configures the instance.
        Specified by:
        build in interface Builder<freemarker.template.Configuration>
        Returns:
        The built instance
